item.title: Report E-2024100054
item.description:
Report E-2024100054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: NEW COLUMBIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XMI experienced a UN2815 Aminoethylpiperazine-HP release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released to an 8' x 15' area of the trailer floor and a 6' x 28' area of the concrete and asphalt lot below. The drum was punctured by a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and simple green were then utilized to clean the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, pallet wood, and cleanup debris were containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: REPORTED TO DOOR 43 IN THE UNLOAD. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID AND OXIDIZER SECOND LABEL. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM CORNER. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT.PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024090572
item.description:
Report E-2024090572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that one (1) cup of material was released due to a crack in one (1) 330-gallons poly tote. Miller Group personnel transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote and cup up the damaged bladder tote. The cup-up tote and impacted cardboard was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generate waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
